creditline: Lent by the Wang Xing Lou Collection
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: celadon glazed chrysanthemum dish, one of a pair
medium: Porcelain with carved decoration under a bluish-green celadon glaze
text: Each of these dishes is molded in the shape of a chrysanthemum flower. Such dishes are usually found in the previous Yung-cheng reign (1723-35) where they were made in a range of at least twelve different colors. The glaze of these plates imitates the classic Lung-chuang celadon of the Sung dynasty (12th century).
title: Chrysanthemum Dish, one of a pair
